transcript.text: Check your understanding of what’s acceptable and what’s not when it comes to entertainment. Select acceptable or unacceptable for these options then click on Submit.

contentText.text: Decide whether these actions are Acceptable or Unacceptable.

instructionText.text: Select Acceptable or Unacceptable for each option then click on Submit.
Click on Next (bottom right arrow) to continue.

option.text: A vendor offers you four tickets to attend a major sporting event with him. They are worth around USD$100 each so, before you accept, you report his offer.
You find out there is an open bid with this vendor but you’re not directly involved, so you decide to accept the tickets.
A different vendor who is not involved in an active bid offers you alternative tickets to a smaller event, valued at USD$20 each. You reject these in favor of the major event tickets.

correct.text:
• Since the value of the major event tickets exceeds USD$200 these must be reported.
  • You should never give or accept gifts or entertainment with customers or vendors during a period when contracts or bids are being negotiated.
  • The value of these tickets is more appropriate but even this entertainment would be inappropriate if there is any attempt to improperly influence you.
